bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order Allowing Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector and Sister M. Angelique, Sister Superior of the House of the Good Shepherd, for a Writ of Certiorari} No.1078 Order.

This matter coming on up in the motion of Edward E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, for an order and writ of certiorari herein, and it appearing that in an action entitled, "In the Matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre and Georgette Normand," numbered 38028, in the Superior Court of the State of Washington for King County,against the petitioners above named, it is sought tox try and determinethem for acts done by the petitioners above named under color of the office of the petitioner. James P. Lavin, as Immigrant Inspector, and on account of his acts done under the revenue and immigration laws of the United States; and the Court being fully advised, and good grounds appearing therefor, it is ordered that a writ of certiorari issue out of this Court, directed to said Court, commanding it to stay all further proceeding in said cause and to send to this Court the record and proceedings therein.
Due and full service of within acknowledge this day of, 189 Attorney for
IN THE circuit COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON Nor. Division
In the petition of Lavin et al for Writ of Certiorari
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. FEB 14 1903 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HMS Walthew Dep.
WILSON R. GAY, UNITED STATES ATTORNEY, SEATTLE, WASHINGTON
